alert.note: Alert for Brown; Calumet; Outagamie; Waupaca; Waushara; Winnebago (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 18 at 5:43PM CST until February 18 at 6:45PM CST by NWS GreenBay
info.description: The National Weather Service in Green Bay has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Southwestern Brown County in northeastern Wisconsin... Western Calumet County in east central Wisconsin... Winnebago County in east central Wisconsin... Eastern Waushara County in central Wisconsin... Southeastern Waupaca County in northeastern Wisconsin... Southern Outagamie County in northeastern Wisconsin... * Until 645 PM CST. * At 542 PM CST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Fremont to near Redgranite to 6 miles south of Wautoma, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Extremely poor visibility in heavy snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts greater than 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes the following highways... Interstate 41 between mile markers 110 and 131, and between mile markers 134 and 159. U.S. Highway 10 between mile markers 259 and 286, and between mile markers 288 and 289. Wisconsin Highway 441 between mile markers 4 and 10. This snow squall will be near... Lake Poygan around 550 PM CST. Rush Lake around 610 PM CST. Oshkosh around 620 PM CST. High Cliff State Park around 630 PM CST. Northern Lake Winnebago around 635 PM CST. Central Lake Winnebago around 645 PM CST. Other locations impacted by this snow squall include Pickett, Butte Des Morts, Mackville, Larsen, Northport, Orihula, Freedom, Borth, Winneconne and Zittau. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce your speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions.

area.areaDesc: Brown; Calumet; Outagamie; Waupaca; Waushara; Winnebago
